private_information: Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_9, next object_12 object_10, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_9, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9
Scenario A goal: next object_12 object_11
Scenario A planned steps: wretched object_5 object_9 object_10 object_3 ; clip object_12 object_5 object_10 ; wretched object_5 object_10 object_11 object_3 ; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_11
player.goal: Analyze Scenario A, check preconditions and effects for each step in the provided plan, and report which steps are applicable given the private information and the public action specifications.

private_information: Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, next object_0 object_5, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_10, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9
Scenario B goal: next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_5
Scenario B has no explicit plan provided
observer.goal: Review Scenario B, identify candidate actions that could achieve the stated goal from the given initial facts according to the public action specifications, and flag any missing prerequisites.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate analyses from the other agents and produce a single consistent PDDL domain and PDDL problem pair suitable for the FastDownwards planner that models both scenarios and supports multi-agent distinct actions.

public_information: Action definitions available: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted each parameterized over object indices as in the use-case.
paltry requires: hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, vase obj0 obj1, next obj1 obj2. paltry effects: add next obj0 obj2, delete vase obj0 obj1.
sip requires: hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, next obj0 obj2, next obj1 obj2. sip effects: add vase obj0 obj1, delete next obj0 obj2.
clip requires: hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, next obj0 obj2. clip effects: add vase obj0 obj1, delete next obj0 obj2.
wretched requires: sneeze obj0, texture obj1, texture obj2, stupendous obj3, next obj0 obj1, collect obj1 obj3, collect obj2 obj3. wretched effects: add next obj0 obj2, delete next obj0 obj1.
memory requires: cats obj0, spring obj1, spring obj2, next obj0 obj1. memory effects: add next obj0 obj2, delete next obj0 obj1.
tightfisted requires: hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, vase obj0 obj1. tightfisted effects: add next obj0 obj2, delete vase obj0 obj1.
Objects are named object_0 through object_12 as referenced in scenarios and plans.
The domain models boolean facts of the form cats(X), hand(X), texture(X), sneeze(X), spring(X), stupendous(X), vase(X,Y), collect(X,Y), next(X,Y).
Two separate scenario statements are provided with different initial conditions and goals; agents may treat them independently before the orchestrator integrates them.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the player agent who knows Scenario A initial facts and the provided plan. Do not emit PDDL. Analyze each planned step in order, check preconditions against your private facts and the public action specifications, state which preconditions are satisfied, identify required facts that are missing, and compute the resulting facts after each applicable action according to the public effects.
analyze.prompt: You are named player. Use the public action specifications from environment->public_information and your private information from agents->player->private_information to analyze the provided plan for Scenario A. For each step, determine applicability, list which preconditions are satisfied or missing, and list the facts that would be added and deleted if the step is applied. Provide a concise, structured analysis. Do not produce PDDL or assume facts not given.

review.system_prompt: You are the observer agent who reviews Scenario B. Do not emit PDDL. Identify which actions from the public action set could be applied to progress toward the scenario goal, list missing prerequisites that would need to be achieved, and propose short sequences of candidate actions without producing a formal PDDL encoding.
review.prompt: You are named observer. Use environment->public_information and your private information from agents->observer->private_information to identify candidate action sequences for Scenario B that could achieve the stated goals. For each candidate action mention required preconditions from the public specs and whether they hold in the initial facts. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator and PDDL author. Your job is to integrate the analyses from the other agents and produce a single consistent PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problem files suitable for the FastDownwards planner. You must target FastDownwards compatibility, keep multi-agent actions distinct when appropriate, and model the predicates and actions described in the public information. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure typing and predicate definitions are consistent and that effects and preconditions reflect the public action specifications.
pddl.prompt: You are named orchestrator. You will receive the player analysis and the observer analysis as inputs (analysis_player and analysis_observer). Integrate their findings with the public action specifications from environment->public_information and produce a PDDL domain suitable for FastDownwards plus PDDL problem files that represent Scenario A and Scenario B initial states and goals. Keep agent actions distinct where analyses indicate different actors. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are naming ambiguities reconcile them and document your choices briefly at the top of the domain comment section.
